page.syntax: C ftp_put_file_multiple(C address ,C user ,C password ,C source_files ,C source_folder ,C destination_folder [,L background ])

argument.name: address
argument.description: The FTP address of the transmission. Character

argument.name: source_files
argument.description: A list of relative filenames of files to be transferred. Character

argument.name: source_folder
argument.description: The top level folder name where the source files are stored. Character

argument.name: destination_folder
argument.description: The name of the folder on the target machine where the files should be transferred. If blank, the files are transferred to the root level specified by the FTP address. Character

argument.name: background
argument.description:
Logical. Optional. Default = .T.
.T. = File transfer takes place in the background. The progress dialog box that is displayed is modeless.
.F. = File transfer takes place in the foreground. The progress dialog box that is displayed is modal.

page.description: Upload a file to a FTP server
page.discussion: The FTP_PUT_FILE_MULTIPLE() function transfers multiple files via FTP. The relative folder structure of the source files is preserved on the target computer.

section.title: Example
section.description: For example, assume that you have a folder called " c:\mydata " which contains these files:
Here is how you could transfer these files using FTP:
section.example: dim list as C list = <<%a% page1.a5w page2.a5w images\image1.jpg images\image2.jpg %a% ftp_put_file_multiple("your.ftpaddress.com", "your_username", "your_password", list, "c:\mydata", "mydata", .f.)
